transcript.text: Spring Boot was created by Rod Johnson and it's  the most popular Java framework for building REST
APIs in like 5 minutes. You generate a project  using Spring Initializr, run it, and boom,
you already have a working server exposing an API.  Want a new endpoint? Just slap an annotation on a
method and specify the path, done. Want to map  a Java class to a database table? Just put an
annotation and specify the table name. Want to  add JWT security? Yeah, that’ll take a while.
Spring Boot is basically the Spring framework  without all the painful configuration. It
comes with everything set up for you so you can  focus on actually building the damn app instead
of fighting XML like people did in the stone  age. No Tomcat installs, no manual configs,
no hosting headaches. Spring Boot takes care  of all that, which makes it stand out. It’s
used worldwide by plenty of tech giants  like Netflix, Amazon, LinkedIn and others.
So they probably know something about it. So when you want to build a Java backend app,
you basically have two choices:  use Spring Boot or be wrong.

title: Spring Boot In A Nutshell
description:
Spring Boot makes it easy to create stand-alone, production-grade Spring based Applications that you can "just run"

#spring #tutorial #java
